problem_text:
Let Wn = A5≀· · ·≀A5 be the n-times iterated permutational wreath product of A5 in its natural action (so Wn acts on 5n points), and let W = lim←−Wn be the inverse limit (infinite iterated wreath product of A5). Does W contain a finitely generated dense subgroup of subexponential growth?
S. Eberhard
